title: Exclusive Q&A Session 73| Daily Evening Bhagavatam Discourse | HH Stoka Krishna Swami |22-12-22
speaker: HH Stoka Krishna Swami

segments.key_quote: If a wrong person has got some skill, he can misuse it.
segments.summary: The speaker explains why Dronacharya asked Ekalavya for his thumb as Guru Dakshina, relating it to the idea that unqualified individuals may misuse knowledge or skills, similar to the concept of Shudras not being taught the Vedas.

segments.key_quote: And to make our destination as Vaikuntha is the correct goal of life.
segments.summary: The speaker discusses the significance of Vaikuntha Ekadashi and passing through Vaikuntha Dwaara, emphasizing that it should remind us to make Vaikuntha our destination after death and to understand our spiritual nature.

segments.key_quote: Passing through Vaikuntha Dwaara is to remind ourselves that we should prepare our consciousness by purifying it of all material contamination.
segments.summary: The speaker elaborates on the need to purify our consciousness from material contamination to attain Vaikuntha, highlighting that material desires prevent us from entering the spiritual world.

segments.key_quote: This going through Vaikuntha Dwara is to remind us that prepare yourself before death comes. Become Krishna conscious.
segments.summary: The speaker explains how to remember Krishna's form, particularly through deity worship and connecting with Krishna's teachings, to prepare for approaching the spiritual kingdom.

segments.key_quote: Krishna will give us remembrance of Him at the time of death and take us back to God.
segments.summary: The speaker emphasizes that remembering Krishna at the time of death is possible through the Lord's mercy, which is attained by consistent practice of remembering Him in this material world.

segments.key_quote: Maha Vishnu first appears, enters the material energy which is lying in a dormant condition, unmanifest condition.
segments.summary: The speaker describes the process of material creation, starting with Maha Vishnu entering the dormant material energy and leading to the birth of Brahma from Garbhodaka Shaini Vishnu.

segments.key_quote: Brahma then understands that he is to do the secondary creation. What is secondary creation? The primary creation is the creation of the ingredients for the creation.
segments.summary: The speaker explains Brahma's role in secondary creation, which involves creating bodies for living entities, after Vishnu has already created the elements.

segments.key_quote: The prayers offered by Brahma is after the initial phase of, different phases of the creation are done by the two Vishnus and then Brahma's work has to begin of generating the living beings given the material body that is the work of creation of Brahma
segments.summary: The speaker discusses Brahma's prayers to Vishnu before creating living entities, expressing sorrow for their inevitable suffering and the cycle of birth and death.

segments.key_quote: As a pure devotee Shiva is actually situated in pure devotional service therefore he is always enlightened as a pure devotee but when he plays the role of a devata then his knowledge is limited
segments.summary: The speaker addresses the question of how Lord Shiva, being a pure devotee, can be said to not know he was created by Krishna, explaining that Shiva's knowledge is limited when he acts as a devata.

segments.key_quote: In his role as a devata he plays the role of a devata because he is a pure devotee to assist the Supreme Lord he is ready to do any seva so one of the services he does is he plays the part of a devata
segments.summary: The speaker continues to explain Shiva's role as a devata, emphasizing that he serves the Supreme Lord in this capacity, and that his knowledge is limited in this role.

segments.key_quote: Bhagavan the word Bhagavan originally applies only to the Supreme Lord Vishnu and his expansions Krishna Rama Narasimha etc
segments.summary: The speaker explains why personalities other than Vishnu are addressed as Bhagavan, attributing it to their extraordinary power and empowerment as confidential servants of the Supreme Lord.

segments.key_quote: Buddha taught a meditation process he has taught a worship process he has taught a philosophy of life for those who are followers of the Buddhist scriptures he has taught everything
segments.summary: The speaker briefly addresses the teachings of Lord Buddha, mentioning meditation, worship, and a philosophy of life.

segments.key_quote: Conjunction means the junction sandhya it's called yuga sandhya just like in the evening after the sun sets still there is some light before it becomes fully dark
segments.summary: The speaker explains the meaning of 'conjunction' in the context of Lord Kalki's appearance, using the analogy of twilight to describe the overlap between yugas.

segments.key_quote: By studying bhagavatam or hearing bhagavatam or reading bhagavatam or distributing bhagavatam either as a book or as the knowledge itself all this will give us devotional service pure devotional service
segments.summary: The speaker discusses the benefits (phala shruti) of studying the Bhagavatam, explaining that it primarily leads to devotional service, but can also grant material benefits, mystic powers, or liberation to those who desire them.

segments.key_quote: Yajna ultimately means to satisfy vishnu or to please vishnu who is also called the chief beneficiary of the sacrificial offerings
segments.summary: The speaker explains the purpose of yajnas, which is to satisfy Vishnu, and discusses the specific goal of the rajasuya yajna, which is to declare sovereignty and glorify Krishna.

segments.key_quote: All prescribed activities in devotional service or bhakti yoga are all methods of purification of the self only
segments.summary: The speaker discusses various methods of purification besides chanting Hare Krishna, including taking prasadam, hearing scriptures, and engaging in other prescribed activities of bhakti yoga.

segments.key_quote: Rudra sampradaya is active among the followers of vallabhacharya in gujarat and rajasthan and vrindavan there are many many many followers of vallabhacharya
segments.summary: The speaker confirms that the Rudra sampradaya is still active, particularly among the followers of Vallabhacharya in Gujarat, Rajasthan, and Vrindavan.

segments.key_quote: For a pure devotee wherever the pure devotee is situated doesn't matter he is always with krishna through his consciousness krishna consciousness
segments.summary: The speaker explains how a Mahatma, or pure devotee, can be situated in the spiritual world even while living on Earth, emphasizing their constant connection with Krishna through Krishna consciousness.

segments.key_quote: Pure devotees also they are engaged in their eternal service to the supreme lord krishna in his krishna's personal about but krishna desires to deliver the conditions also the pure devotees also appear and assist in the mission of the supreme lord
segments.summary: The speaker elaborates on the role of pure devotees, explaining that they assist the Lord in his mission to deliver conditioned souls, even while remaining in the spiritual world.

segments.key_quote: Your faith is tested when in adverse conditions you still are able to continue with your devotional services
segments.summary: The speaker explains that one's faith in Krishna is tested by their ability to continue devotional service even in adverse conditions, and that continued practice is necessary for advancement.

segments.key_quote: Devotional service begins with a small beginning like chanting 108 times hara krishna mantra every day takes about 10 minutes in the beginning
segments.summary: The speaker advises starting devotional service with small, regular practices like chanting and gradually increasing the time spent on spiritual life under the guidance of experienced devotees.

segments.key_quote: The reality of the truth is krishna bestows mercy on everyone it is that some people are not taking that mercy or are not ready to receive that mercy
segments.summary: The speaker explains that Krishna bestows mercy on everyone, but some people are not ready or willing to receive it.

segments.key_quote: This chanting harry krishna means receiving the blessings and mercy of krishna through holy name that's what it means but not everybody will accept it not everybody will follow it
segments.summary: The speaker uses the example of chanting Hare Krishna to illustrate how Krishna's mercy is available to all, but not everyone accepts or follows it, emphasizing Krishna's equality and fairness.

segments.key_quote: All actions of vishnu are transcendental they are not under the more so material nature and whether he gets apparently defeated or he wins there is no difference between uh victory and defeat
segments.summary: The speaker discusses the transcendental nature of Vishnu's pastimes, explaining that apparent defeats or victories are not the same as in the material world and that they can be misleading to atheists.

segments.key_quote: Generally when we quit the body we immediately get the next body but in the case where somebody has been sinful then such a person is taken to yamaraj by the yamadukas where yamaraj's court the person is tried and is given a punishment
segments.summary: The speaker explains the process of obtaining the next body after death, noting that sinful individuals are judged by Yamaraj, while devotees may go back to Godhead or get another chance to continue their devotional service.

segments.key_quote: For those who are sinful they are taken to yamaraj and in yama raj's court they are tried and then uh they are punished and that punishment they have to suffer in one yatana sharira they are given a special body for getting the punishment experience of the pain experience of the suffering
segments.summary: The speaker continues to describe the fate of sinful individuals, explaining that they are punished in Yamaraj's court and experience suffering, but Paramatma is always with them.

segments.key_quote: Paying obeisances is a practice of sadhana bhakti because we have a a false ego because of which we think we are great or we are the lord of the boss or the master but the process of bhakti is to become and to take a subordinate position
segments.summary: The speaker explains the importance of paying obeisances to Vaishnavas and Krishna as a practice of sadhana bhakti, emphasizing that it helps to overcome false ego, cultivate humility, and accelerate spiritual advancement.

segments.key_quote: The son of Rishabhdev, he was a pure devotee. He was called Bharat Maharaj and he was a pure devotee visible in the world. After him, the world was named Bharat Varsha.
segments.summary: The speaker clarifies that not all Bharatas mentioned in the Bhagavatam were pure devotees, identifying the son of Rishabhdev as the pure devotee after whom Bharat Varsha was named.

segments.key_quote: In Vrindavan, lot of work is happening to improve the dilapidated condition of so many temples and also in Jagannath Puri, so much of renovation and improvement is happening in the Jagannath temple.
segments.summary: The speaker addresses a question about temple renovation, clarifying that Krishna temples are also being renovated and improved, citing examples in Vrindavan and Jagannath Puri.

segments.key_quote: Nothing is complex in spiritual subject matter. It is just that it has to be properly explained by a self-realized person, just like Prabhupada explains.
segments.summary: The speaker addresses the question of understanding complex spiritual matters, stating that nothing is complex if properly explained by a self-realized person like Prabhupada, and emphasizing the need to prepare one's consciousness and clear misconceptions.

segments.key_quote: The correct way to understand spiritual subject matter is to prepare oneself by purification of the heart. What is this purification? To clear away the misconceptions which we have developed by long association with this material nature.
segments.summary: The speaker continues to explain how to understand spiritual matters, emphasizing the importance of purifying the heart by clearing away misconceptions through chanting Hare Krishna and understanding Prabhupada's teachings.

segments.key_quote: Shukadeva Goswami is the son of Vyasa Deva. Shukadeva Goswami was taught the Bhagavatam by Vyasa Deva. Vyasa Deva composed or compiled the Bhagavatam.
segments.summary: The speaker clarifies the roles of Shukadeva Goswami and Suta Goswami in the narration of the Bhagavatam, explaining their lineage and the circumstances of their speaking the scripture.

segments.key_quote: Maitreya Rishi is one of the sages. He actually attained enlightenment by hearing from his Guru. There is a disciplic succession in which Maitreya Rishi appears. Maitreya Rishi speaks to Vidura, enlightens Vidura.
segments.summary: The speaker identifies Maitreya Rishi and explains how he attained enlightenment through hearing from his Guru in a disciplic succession, tracing it back to Lord Sankarsana and the Kumaras.

segments.key_quote: In the spiritual world, everyone is naturally always blissful, always blissful, the very quality of it, always blissful, always blissful. Being happy is the characteristic of spiritual existence. Whereas the material world, by nature, it is filled with miseries.
segments.summary: The speaker addresses the possibility of sense gratification in the spiritual world, explaining that spiritual senses and bodies exist there, and that the natural state is bliss, contrasting it with the misery-filled material world where happiness is sought through sense gratification.
